metadata.title: CVE-2018-20506 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
SQLite before 3.25.3, when the FTS3 extension is enabled, encounters aninteger overflow (and resultant buffer overflow) for FTS3 queries in a"merge" operation that occurs after crafted changes to FTS3 shadow tables,allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging theability to run arbitrary SQL statements (such as in certain WebSQL usecases). This is a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-20346.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20506` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.8.2-1ubuntu2.2+esm1
libsqlite3-0 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu2.2+esm1
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.8.2-1ubuntu2.2+esm1
sqlite3 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu2.2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sqlite3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.2-1ubuntu2.2+esm1').
